messages.subject: Re: Dad's not 'understanding' un-sch
messages.msgSnippet: ... schoolwork we accomplished.  Sometimes I ll give him a bit of educationese related to our day s activities. He s all for HS,  not sure about unschooling.
messages.messageBody:
>
>just had to comment, my dh also still asks about school and what
'schoolwork' we accomplished. Sometimes I'll give him a bit of educationese
related to our day's activities.
He's all for HS, not sure about unschooling.
Suz

>Laura,
> Well, now my husband is totally for homeschooling!!! He never
suggests
>putting the kids back in school at all. And although he doesn't really
>understand unschooling (he still comes home and asks how school was
>today----or asks to see some of the kids schoolpapers), he really loves the
>difference it has made in our kids.
> Let your husband see the difference this year makes to your kids, then
>he will probably be behind homeschooling 100%.
>Tami
>
>>Check it out!
>http://www.unschooling.com
>
